title: meet penarth man designed new town parklets
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityJohn Davies, owner ofCandid Creative Studio, worked with the Vale of Glamorgan Council on the parklets after taking part in a competition to design and manage the installation of artwork to celebrate Penarth.In all it took around a month to complete, from the initial conceptualisation meetings through to agreeing the final artwork.ldquoWe carefully balanced the needs for the parklets to have an identity, promote and shout about Penarth, and also appeal to the public at large, he said.Parklets are extensions of trading space built out into existing parking bays that allow businesses to safely accommodate a greater number of customers.D signs of Bridgend fitted the vinyl artwork just in time for outdoor hospitality to open on Monday, April .ldquoIt is Penarthrsquos very own unique and erse architectural heritage which formed the inspiration to the parklets artwork, he added.ldquoThe townrsquos famous landmarks, as well as some lesser known ones, join quirky seaside elements, to decorate the glass .The parklets offer a great opportunity for hospitality businesses to welcome back customers, with some shelter, while they cannot currently open inside.MORE NEWS:lsquoHe will always be in my heartrsquo: Woman raises over pound, in memory of childhood friendPenarth man ordered to repay pound, after selling counterfeit goodsCan you help  Appeal after boombox, toilet and more dumped at Vale parkThe final designed parklets can be seen outside Willmorersquos  on Stanwell Road, and Foxys Deli, Victoria Roadand Gin .ldquoOutside the business opportunities, on a sunny day they also animate Penarthrsquos streets, encourage residents and tourists to stay a little longer in the town and enjoy everything Penarth has he added.ldquoBusinesses and the public alike have enjoyed using the parklets since last week, and feedback on the artwork has been very positive.     For Mr Daviesrsquo graphic design businesses, he says the last few months since the lockdown on December  has lsquoremained steady.rsquoldquoI am very lucky to work with a range of clients ndash the NHS, national charities, ambitious locals, small businesses, and everyone in between ndash who have needed to adapt themselves to the changing landscape caused by the pandemic.ldquoThat ability to stay nimble has allowed my clients to weather the storm so far, and I am faithful that will continue as we see the pandemic in the rear view mirror. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: rnli penarth looking lifeboat station historian
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe role will see them revealing the stories behind the townrsquos leboat station since it re-opened in , as well as collecting information and statistics on the boats and launches.The volunteer will research and collect oral histories from the many people who have been involved with the station over the years.From past boat crew and family members to the hundreds of volunteers and people throughout the community who have come into contact with the station over the last .RNLI Penarthrsquos first leboat station was built in  for a cost of pound, before being relocated in  when Penarth Esplanade was constructed.The station closed in , and the town had no leboat station for another  years. Not until the increasing popularity of Penarth as a destination for tourism and leisure boating saw the need for leboat services to be re-established in .MORE NEWS:#The current purpose-built station was constructed in .The history of the th century station has been well-documented, but not its history since , which is what this new role will uncover.Laurie Pavelin, chair of RNLI Penarth Leboat Station, said: ldquoPenarthrsquos leboat station has been a central part of the community since , and in that time it has played a part in many peoplersquos lives.ldquoThe people of Penarth have volunteered, fundraised, attended events, brought safety lessons to schools, and played a part in RNLIrsquos lesaving work in so many dferent ways.ldquoWersquore looking forward to welcoming a new volunteer historian who will make sure those stories are preserved for the community. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local community.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething at the count for the Senedd elections iltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgtn the House of Sportltspan classtruncate-full-screengt, Cardf today.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Senedd Election : Vaughan Gething retains Cardf South and Penarth seat.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething with his son and we celebrating afterltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgt winning Cardf Soultspan classtruncate-full-screengtth and Penarth during the count for the Senedd elections in the House of Sport, Cardf.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Senedd Election : Vaughan Gething retains Cardf South and Penarth seat.. - Picture shows Vaughan Gething celebrating after winning Cardf Southltspan classtruncategtltspan classtruncate-previewgt and Penarth during ltspan classtruncate-full-screengtthe count for the Senedd elections in the House of Sport, Cardf.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentVAUGHAN Gething has retained his seat in the Senedd.Mr Gething, who has represented Cardf South and Penarth since , has secured his seat by a majority of more than , votes.The Labour representative received , votes."Im delighted with the result," he said."A really strong showing across Cardf South and Penarth. When we saw the boxes being opened in Penarth we also saw there was a very strong showing there."It was hard to tell how all of the votes scattered amongst the fringe parties, but in the main parties it was clear that we were going to have a good result."When asked about what is in store for next term, he said: "Well we need to see what the national results are, and Ive still got choices to make as the health minister until a new government is formed."Some of those are still big and dficult, and I think its part of the reason why people renwed their faith in us and that is because they recognise there are still challenges to navigate our way through."But I really do look forward to within tis next term being able to see people in a more normal way - to go to more community events and have more of the person to person contact weve all missed in this last year and more."This year saw a sizeable increase in voter turnout with , votes cast- . per cent - compared to . per cent in .The full results for Cardf South and Penarth are as follows:Vaughan Gething- ,Leighton Rowlands- ,Nasir Adam- ,Helen Westhead- ,Alex Wilson- ,Paul Campbell- Lisa Peregrine- Matt Friend- Alan Pick- Alan Golding- David Rolfe- Angus Hawkins-  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry.lt spangtlt spangtlt spangt" Watch: Senedd Election : Meet the new MSs for South Wales CentralAndrew RT Davies" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentBOTH the Conservative and Plaid Cymru won two seats in the South Wales Central region.Rhys ap Owen and Heledd Fychan were elected for Plaid, with Welsh Conservative leader Andrew RT Davies retaining his seat in the region, along with Joel James.Neither Mr Davies nor Mr Jones attended the count at the Barry Memo Arts Centre today, despite the Welsh Conservatives securingtheir best ever Senedd result ndash winning  seats.On the partys overall result, Mr Davies said: ldquoFirstly, Irsquod like to say a huge thank you to our outstanding set of Welsh Conservative candidates, activists and staff whorsquove worked incredibly hard throughout this campaign and secured the partys best ever Senedd result.ldquoThe team has gone above and beyond and deserve great credit for the positive campaign wersquove run right across Wales, and I am thrilled to see Natasha Asghar make history in South Wales East by becoming the first female from a BAME background to be elected to the Senedd.ldquoAs a party we are also delighted to have secured constituency seats in the Vale of Clwyd and Brecon and Radnorshire, and increased seats on the regional lists, resulting in our highest ever representation in the Senedd with  members.ldquoItrsquos been an unconventional campaign and itrsquos clear incumbency and continuity has played a signicant part. To that end, I would like to offer my sincere congratulations to Mark Drakeford and Welsh Labour on a successful campaign.ldquoThe election has been fought in good spirit by political parties in Wales and I would like to pay a final word of thanks to the many officials across the country whorsquove allowed this election to take place in a safe and effective manner.Plaid Cymru gained an extra seat this election, which was occupied by Ukip in , secured  seats in the Senedd in total and meant Labour fell short of a majority in Wales.Speaking on the win, Heledd Fychan of Plaid Cymru said she feels ldquoincredibly honoured, humbled and excited and that there will be a lot of ldquoreading and preparing in the coming days.     Spoke with @heleddfychan after Plaid secured two seats at the South Wales Central counts #SeneddVote pic GKeJwmdash BrookeMay , ldquoI know the first thing that I want to focus on in the Senedd is fighting for independent inquiry into the  floods that devastated communities from the Vale of Glamorgan right to the Cynon Valley.ldquoSo thatrsquos definitely one of my first priorities.ldquoGiven that we werenrsquot able to campaign until April  or knock any doors Irsquom extremely proud that wersquove achieved an increase in number of members we have in the Senedd.Heledd Fychan of Plaid Cymru after being elected to the Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry. Picture: Huw Evans Picture AgencyldquoPersonally in Pontypridd we raised the vote by four percent, which I was incredibly proud of and I think the fact that we have so many new, fresh faces coming to the Senedd means that there is a lot of excitement about what we will be able to achieve as a group.Mr ap Owen added: "Its sinking in now slowly. It always looked likely that we were going to get regional seats here in South Wales Central but we dont quite believe it until it actually happens."Rhys ap Owen of Plaid Cymru after being elected to the Senedd for the South Wales Central seat at the Senedd election count at Memo Arts Centre in Barry. Picture: Huw Evans Picture AgencyHe says that campaigning during the coronavirus pandemic has been "dficult" and "unusual.""Usually we would be knocking doors for well over a year before an election and we havent been able to do that so it has been a very dferent election to any I have experienced."The full results are below:Welsh Labour ndash ,Welsh Conservatives ndash ,Plaid Cymru - ,Wales Green Party ndash ,Welsh Liberal Democrats ndash ,Abolish the Welsh Assembly Party - ,Propel - ,Ukip - Scrap the Assembly Senedd ndash ,Reform UK - ,No More Lockdowns - ,Gwlad - The Welsh Independence Party - ,Britains Communist Party - Alan Coulthard ndash Trade Unionist and Socialist Coalition - Workers Party ndash  article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: labours alun michael re elected south wales pcc
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityAlun Michael" Labours Alun Michael re-elected as South Wales PCC for third timeAlun Edward Michael" Skip to next photo Show caption  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl" href" my account emailthispage " s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentALUN Michael has been re-elected as the Police and Crime Commissioner for South Wales.The Welsh Labour politician has been serving as the PCC since the role was created in , and will continue to do so for another four years after winning  per cent of the total vote.Conservative candidate Steve Gallagher came in second with  per cent.Among first preference votes, Mr Michael received , ndash or . percent ndash falling short of the  per cent needed to win re-election.Alun Michael speaking after his winOnce the top two were confirmed, the second preference votes were counted ndash those whose first choice was eliminated ndash which saw Mr Michael elected with , votes, and Steve Gallagher had ,.Speaking on his win, Mr Michael said: ldquoItrsquos been a very strange election, coming as it does in the period of Covid-.ldquoSo my first thanks are to the other candidates who have shown stamina through that period.MORE NEWS:ldquoWe took part in a number of speech debates and they were constructed exchanges about things that matter to the electorate of South Wales.ldquoThank you to all the staff who have been involved in the count, including the police officers who have been here to deal with any outbreaks but fortunately they havenrsquot had to deal with.ldquoYou have all shown incredible stamina throughout the last few days with the challenges of the count in this period of Covid-.ldquoAnd thank you in particular to the electorate of South Wales across the  constituencies. I take very seriously indeed the responsibilities the votes cast today place on my shoulders in trying to deliver and to continue to improve the effectiveness of policing.ldquoMy commitment is to do that with renewed energy.     The job of a PCC is to oversee how crime is tackled in their area. They hold their forces to account and set local force priorities and budgets. They also scrutinise the chief constable with the power to appoint and dismiss them.They also work with local partners to prevent crime. The hope is that their democratic mandate from the public makes them more accountable and able to respond to local peoplersquos concerns.First preference votes:Second preference votes:Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: wales send hundreds ventilators india
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityThe Welsh Government and NHS Wales are providing around  oxygen concentrators and more than  ventilators which are due to leave for India in the coming days.Health minister Vaughan Gething said: ldquoCovid- is a global threat and as such it is right that we are part of the global response, supporting other nations.ldquoWe have worked closely with the UK Government and the Government of India on the logistics in arranging for these supplies to be transported to India and distributed to the hospitals where they are needed most.Mr Gething and chairman of Waless branch of the British Association of Physicians of Indian OriginProfessor Keshav Singhal visited the NHS Wales National Distribution Centre on Monday, May , to inspect the supplies.MORE NEWS:Flights are being arranged by the Foreign Commonwealth and Development Office. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: hundreds thousands spent two roads vale now wont get built
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityFor several years Vale of Glamorgan council was drawing up plans to build a road from the A to the M, and another road bypassing Dinas Powys.But last month the Welsh Government announced it would not fund building these new roads, as part of its new transport strategy which focuses on public and active transport.Now the Vale council has revealed the total cost spent on these two roads which have now been cancelled: pound,.More NewsLabours Alun Michael re-elected as South Wales PCCDisruption on train lines between Wales and London todayLook whorsquos just been in court from Barry and St AthanThe costs include hiring consultants to draw up plans for where the roads would potentially go, as well as y public consultation to seethere were support for them.The road from the A at Sycamore Cross to the M at Junction  proved highly unpopular as concerns ranged from houses getting knocked down to ancient woodland felled.That road has cost pound,, which was funded by grants from the Welsh Government.The road bypassing Dinas Powys however was generally supported by the public, and was part of a wider project to improve transport infrastructure in the village like better bus shelters and cycling routes. The bypass could have cut congestion in Dinas too, a current problem.The wider Dinas transport project has cost pound,, mostly from Welsh Government, but including pound, from the Vale council.Councillor Peter King, cabinet member for transport, said: ldquoWelsh Government is moving very much away from road building into tackling climate change, which I really find some dficulty objecting to.ldquoIt has always frustrated me that the work was seen as the Dinas Powys bypass. But it wasnrsquot mdash it was the Dinas Powys transport infrastructure, because it included all sorts of things, including cycle networks and better access to train stations.     He revealed the costs during a meeting of the full council on Monday, April , after a question from Cllr Ian Johnson, leader of the Plaid Cymru group on the Vale.However some of the wider works to improve transport around Dinas could still be funded where, like from the Cardf Capital Region, a body of  councils across south-east Wales. One project that could go ahead includes a cycle route from Newport to Barry.Cllr King said: ldquoWe think we can probably pursue some of [wider work] through the city region, and we have also been awarded money for the active travel Newport to Barry route. So some of the other elements of the transport infrastructure we can pursue.ldquoBut wersquoll wait until after the election [on May ] to see whorsquos in charge, before we decide what to do next. article_url   content_id   site_id  _rpzlatijbsrjaehzoqlqce url  "survey.g.doubleclick.net survey site"+site_id+"url"+article_url+"cid"+content_id+"random"+.getTime+try  __Show catch console.log  s.eventsevents.linkTrackVarseVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eVar,eventss.linkTrackEventsevents.tl"commentSorry, an error occurred.Sign in or register leave a comment or rate a comment -- []sw.documents.asynctruestext javascripts.src+static++.plista async++.jsg  --Most readCommented"Loading...Read more Get involved with the news in your communitySend your stories and photos now--       ByThis website and associated newspapers adhere to the Independent Press Standards Organisations Editors Code of Practice. title: nine year old dubai dj scratches way fame world contest
story: As a subscriber, you are shown % less display advertising when reading our articles.Those ads you do see are predominantly from local businesses promoting local services. These adverts enable local businesses to get in front of their target audience – the local communityMichelle Rasul was already spinning turntables, scratching hip-hop records and making the beats drop four years ago, when she was just learning how to read and write.Four years later, she is one of the worldrsquos top DJs and competed in this yearrsquos global championship.At her home in the skyscraper-studded city of Dubai, the turntable whiz from Azerbaijan nodded her baseball cap-adorned head to the beat and showed off her skills scratching, cutting and fading. vw,vw,px, px"Michelle Rasul enjoys scratching her turntable in the lobby of her apartment building in Dubai Her tiny fingers flew across the turntable as she created a sizzling landscape of electric audio effects and recalled how she got her start as a child turntable celebrity ndash which, in fact, was not all that long ago.ldquoI looked at my dad while he was practising DJ-ing and I saw him and was like, lsquoWow, is he doing magic or something  Hersquos a real magician, bro!rsquo Michelle told the Associated Press, bubbling with enthusiasm.ldquoWhen I turned five, on my birthday, I told him, lsquoDad, I want to be a world famous DJ. Irsquom going to start practisingrsquo.As though recounting a decades-long career, she grinned and added: ldquoAnd the rest is history. vw,vw,px, px"Michelle Rasul chases a friendrsquos dog at a park near her house Michelle, the youngest-ever contestant in the DMC World DJ Championship, ranked th out of  DJ stars from around the world in the Portablist category this year, the global portable scratch competition.The  competition was held online due to the coronavirus pandemic.Although she did not advance to the next round this time, she is determined to beat her father, Vag ldquoDJ Shock Rasulov, a professional who taught her the tricks of the trade and was ninth this year, in next yearrsquos competition.     ldquoI love competing in battles, I just love DJ-ing, she said.ldquoItrsquos my passion. vw,vw,px, px"Michelle Rasul scratching her turntable Turntabling, which burst on to the music scene from hip-hop artists in the late s, can look like a basic act ndash taking a record, putting the needle down and sliding it back and forth with onersquos fingertips.But for the wizards, it is an art form, involving spontaneous sound mixing and advanced techniques like quick, rhythmic scratches and ldquocrabs, rubbing the record under the needle.From the moment her parents gave her a mini DJ starter kit, they recognised her extraordinary abilities.Even as a baby, she was fascinated and would punch all the buttons on her fatherrsquos equipment.ldquoShe just catches things so fast, said her mother Sadia Rasulova, a former violinist who also encouraged Michellersquos love of music. vw,vw,px, px"Michelle Rasul playing the piano ldquoI realised that shersquos a star, that shersquos really talented.When her peers were listening to nursery rhymes, or as she put it, ldquoBaby Shark stuff or ABC songs, Michelle said she was hooked on rap legends such as Tupac Shakur, Chuck D, Jay-Z, the Notorious B.I.G. and Michael Jackson, who remains her favourite.Her parents started posting footage of her scratching online, and Michellersquos popularity exploded.Her Instagram account and persona as the self-described ldquoyoungest DJ in the world has racked up , followers.Online messages from aspiring DJs aged six to  poured in from around the globe, she said. vw,vw,px, px"Michelle Rasul jumps around in the lobby of her apartment Michellersquos feed is populated with posts of her breakdancing and scratching furiously alongside her sunglasses-sporting father, spinning hip-hop and techno tunes live for her listeners, strumming the bass in her free time and playing at events such as Dubairsquos recent food festival.Before the pandemic put big gatherings on hold, Michelle performed regularly at weddings, parties and music festivals across the city.While the rest of the world is focused on her accomplishments as a DJ star, Michelle is busy bouncing through le, attending online school, skateboarding, reading and hanging out with friends and dogs at her neighbourhood park.But her heart is always in her turntabling.ldquoI canrsquot imagine my le without music, she said.ldquoLike from the start, from the very beginning, when I was really little..push,i[r].l*new
